Koch Industries, Inc. All rights reserved.

We don't just raise the beef folks crave. We’re raising the standard through our beef quality assurance certification – the highest quality level in the industry. The Matador Cattle Company operates three ranches totaling more than 460,000 acres and 12,000 cattle, preserving the cowboy way for generations to come.

Nature, meet nurture.

Our enduring commitment to extremely high quality beef is matched by our devotion to preserve the land on which that beef is raised. We’re unwavering in our respect for the history, lifestyle and natural resources of these rolling acres. Whether at our Beaverhead Ranch near Yellowstone National Park in Montana, our Spring Creek Ranch in the Flint Hills of Kansas or the historic Matador Ranch in West Texas, the rugged and rewarding horse raising, cattle ranching life is here to stay.

Their Home on the Range

Ambition To Reality

Big ideas are just the beginning. The real challenge is putting them in motion.

Best Remuda Award

Bred for Success

Each year, the American Quarter Horse Association and Zoetis recognizes one ranch worldwide for outstanding performance of a working ranch. Matador Ranch was the 2013 award recipient.

Wildlife at Work

Read Story

ENVIRONMENTAL EXCELLENCE

For its commitment to wildlife habitat conservation and environmental stewardship, Matador Cattle Company’s Beaverhead Ranch received international recognition from the Wildlife Habitat Council.

MBM® Principles in Practice

Bob, ranch manager at Matador Ranch, explains the benefits of applying Market-Based Management® to his job.

Matador Cattle Company

Food. Shelter. Clothing. Transportation. Koch Industries creates life’s basic necessities, while innovating ways to make them even better. Yet our advocacy for a free and open society is what truly sets us apart.
